column5: Hey guys got the chance to head up to the kawarthas the other day with  fellow ofner (eric)..we got on the water at 3oclock and the conditions were tough ....35deg and not a ripple on the lake..between 3 and 6 we only landed one decent smallie about 1.5lb and and a couple more the same size got away . just around dinner time we found some active fish that kept spitting out these tastey crustations...lol...i guess our tubes were a good fake  heres a few of the fish  a 3lber and a 2lber   we ended up landing about ten smallies in about an hour...most were just under 2lb but i got one 3lber...we also long distance released on jumps about another half dozen that were decent...i wanted to troll a crank by tjis island that always produces a walleye or muskie at dusk and 2min into trolling i got this 2lb eye also got bit off by a ski...i think we would of caught another eye or a ski if we trolled for a few more min but eric had to be at work for the night shift....was a gorgeous day on the water and we got some fish....beats workin
Great report and pics!!!  I'd say that 3 lber looks closer to 12-6!
I was just about to say the same thing!  Nice fish btw...
got it now...lol the record bass caught...lol .. i wish
Read the thread about the new "record" smallie and you'll be enlightened
Nice fish and your dead on about the beats working bit, come on weekend!
Nice. Those are some really nice colours on those smallies! Nothing beats tubing for smallies!
NICE work out there Snagmaster. Will you be my guide?
Great catch guys !!!!!!!!    very nice size smallies, oh ya and the tasty walleye too.....nice report   cheers
Just can't beat a good smallie fight, nice pics man!
thanks guys...Hey woodro i dont think you need a guide man. youv been getting all the buckets
